thread.title: Portland Metro Wednesday Traffic: TriMet E-Fare construction continues at Goose Hollow station and begins at Beaverton Central
thread.title_full: Portland Metro Wednesday Traffic: TriMet E-Fare construction continues at Goose Hollow station and begins at Beaverton Central | OregonLive.com

author: Rosemarie Stein | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Portland Metro Wednesday Traffic: TriMet E-Fare construction continues at Goose Hollow station and begins at Beaverton Central
text:
Daily traffic » All traffic news » PDX Traffic Alerts on Twitter » Elliot Njus's Hard Drive blog » All weather news » School closures/delays
Clear skies and clear roads start the morning commute. Let's keep it that way.
DOWNTOWN 8:45 a.m.; Crash in the right exit lanes from I/5 northbound to I/84 eastbound. ODOT on the scene now. Slowing over the top of the Marquam Bridge.
***
NORTHWEST PORTLAND 8:35 a.m.; Crash blocks the left lane eastbound on U.S. 26 just after the zoo exit. Expect slowing. QUICKLY CLEARED.
***
BEAVERTON 8:00 a.m.; Crash reported near Southwest Farmington Road and Murray Boulevard.
***
UPDATE ALOHA 7:50 a.m.; Crews heading to a reported crash on Southwest Tualatin Valley Highway and 178th Avenue, Aloha. Cleared to shoulder.
***
BATTLE GROUND 7:08 a.m.; Non-injury crash involving a school bus west of Battle Ground on Northeast 199th Street and 72nd Avenue. Bus had no student aboard.
***
Today TriMet begins construction on the new E-Fare system at the Beaverton Central Station. Expect some pedestrian detours, some dust and equipment and expect it to last about two weeks.
Other stations installing the new system through the end of the month include Merlo/SW 158 th and Old Town/Chinatown. For a complete list of E-Fare construction projects, click here.
Check back throughout the morning for the latest commuting updates and follow us on Twitter: @trafficportland
#pdxtraffic Tweets Find you full Portland-area traffic report here. (The Oregonian file photo) Heidi Williams | The Oregonian/OregonLive
